body_html:
Hi everybody.

I have the same problem using the Tensorflow Java API when executing the load static method of SavedModelBundle class and the run method of the Runner class.
What my application does is to capture pictures of the IP camera and classify it.
This app runs in Maven project, where includes Tensorflow 1.8.0 and proto 1.8.0

OS Platform: Linux Ubuntu 16.4
I'm not using GPU.
I've been using nmon to monitor the memory usage.

When the application starts. The free percent memory is 39.5%
After 3 hours the free percent goes to 13.8%

After 3 hours

@chrisrsipes
Have you discovered something to avoid this memory occupation?

@tensorflowbutler
Does Google have any new information about this problem?

body:
Hi everybody.

I have the same problem using the Tensorflow Java API when executing the load static method of SavedModelBundle class and the run method of the Runner class.
What my application  does is to capture pictures of the IP camera and classify it.
This app runs in Maven project, where includes Tensorflow 1.8.0 and proto 1.8.0

**OS Platform: Linux Ubuntu 16.4**
**I'm not using GPU.**
I've been using nmon to monitor the memory usage.

When the application starts. The free percent memory is **39.5%**
After 3 hours the free percent goes to **13.8%**

![smart 95 - 2018_05_02_14_54_58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38957144/39591885-82608ca4-4edb-11e8-815c-74b159646131.png)


After 3 hours
![2018_05_03_14_11_28_root](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38957144/39592065-167ce798-4edc-11e8-99e6-6c3144526a32.png)

@chrisrsipes 
Have you discovered something to avoid this memory occupation?

@tensorflowbutler 
Does Google have any new information about this problem?
